comment: This is generated by ESQL's AbstractFunctionTestCase. Do not edit it. See ../README.md for how to regenerate it.
name: network_direction
description: Returns the direction type (inbound, outbound, internal, external) given a source IP address, destination IP address, and a list of internal networks.

params.name: source_ip
params.description: Source IP address of type `ip` (both IPv4 and IPv6 are supported).

params.name: destination_ip
params.description: Destination IP address of type `ip` (both IPv4 and IPv6 are supported).

params.name: internal_networks
params.description: List of internal networks. Supports IPv4 and IPv6 addresses, ranges in CIDR notation, and named ranges.

params.name: source_ip
params.description: Source IP address of type `ip` (both IPv4 and IPv6 are supported).

params.name: destination_ip
params.description: Destination IP address of type `ip` (both IPv4 and IPv6 are supported).

params.name: internal_networks
params.description: List of internal networks. Supports IPv4 and IPv6 addresses, ranges in CIDR notation, and named ranges.

examples:
FROM hosts |
WHERE mv_count(ip0) == 1 AND mv_count(ip1) == 1 |
EVAL direction = network_direction(ip0, ip1, ["loopback"]) |
KEEP ip0, ip1, direction
